Platform.Title: JCVI PFGRC Mycobacterium tuberculosis 22K v2.1 array designed primarily based on strain H37Rv
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: 2QMT, with arrayer LUCIDEA, mode Normal, replicates 4, repeats 1, slide_dips 38, machine cycles 1783814, pen id 0, pen cycles -1, operator Jon, humidity control On, humidity set point65
Platform.Description: This set includes 4742 oligonucleotides, has 22080 spots distributed in 96 blocks.

Sample.Title: H37Rv_hypoxia_4hr_rep1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: 0.2% O2 (Balance N2) introduced into flask at a rate of 0.15 cfm and allowed to exit through 0.2 micron filter. Samples (15-60mL) taken via pipette introduced into the flask while gas continued to flow. Samples centrifuged for 5 minutes at 3000 RPM to softly pellet, superenatent decanted and pellet flash frozen in dry ice/ethanol bath.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Grown to mid log phase (OD600 0.3-0.5) in 2L roller bottles with 200-400 mL Middlebrook 7H9 media+ADC and Tween. Diluted to an OD of 0.1 and transferred to three-armed flask.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Pellets were bead beat in the presence of trizol. Aqueus phase isolated using phase lock gel. RNA precipitated in 50% isopropanol 50% high salt solution ((0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). RNA purified using Rneasy columns from Qiagen.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Standard amino-allyl labelling protocol from TIGR. cDNA made with Superscript III using aminoallyl dUTP. cDNA purified using Qiaquick column from Qiagen. Tags conjugated to reactive Cy dyes in the presence of sodium carbonate. Excess Cy dye removed with a Qiaquick column from Qiagen. Probes resuspended in hyb buffer (50% formamide, 5X SSC, and 0.1% SDS) and kept at room temp until added to array slides.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: 0.2% O2 (Balance N2) introduced into flask at a rate of 0.15 cfm and allowed to exit through 0.2 micron filter. Samples (15-60mL) taken via pipette introduced into the flask while gas continued to flow. Samples centrifuged for 5 minutes at 3000 RPM to softly pellet, superenatent decanted and pellet flash frozen in dry ice/ethanol bath.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Grown to mid log phase (OD600 0.3-0.5) in 2L roller bottles with 200-400 mL Middlebrook 7H9 media+ADC and Tween. Diluted to an OD of 0.1 and transferred to three-armed flask.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Pellets were bead beat in the presence of trizol. Aqueus phase isolated using phase lock gel. RNA precipitated in 50% isopropanol 50% high salt solution ((0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). RNA purified using Rneasy columns from Qiagen.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Standard amino-allyl labelling protocol from TIGR. cDNA made with Superscript III using aminoallyl dUTP. cDNA purified using Qiaquick column from Qiagen. Tags conjugated to reactive Cy dyes in the presence of sodium carbonate. Excess Cy dye removed with a Qiaquick column from Qiagen. Probes resuspended in hyb buffer (50% formamide, 5X SSC, and 0.1% SDS) and kept at room temp until added to array slides.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Slides prehybed for >1 hour in prehyb buffer (5X SSC, 0.1% SDS, 1% BSA), washed 2X for 1 minute in water, 15 seconds in isopropanol, dried by centrifugation. Probes added to slides, sealed in incubation chambers and submerged in 42 degree incubator overnight. Arrays washed in increasingly stringent washes: 5 minutes at 42 degrees low stringency wash (0.2%SDS, 1XSSC), 10 minutes lower stringency wash (0.2%SDS, 0.1XSSC), 4 times 1 minute in 0.1XSSC, 10 seconds in 0.01XSSC. Slides dried by centrifugation.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Arrays scanned in with a GenePix4000B using GenePix 6 scanning software. Gain adjusted during preview scan to roughly equivalence between channels with a few saturated spots.
Sample.Data-Processing: Data analysis conducted with Acuity 4 software package. Spots flagged as not found were excised from the dataset. Remaining features were lowess normalized seperately for each print tip.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Mean of all not-flagged features for each substance lowess normalized log2 ratio (hypoxic sample/log phase sample)

Sample.Title: H37Rv_hypoxia_12hr_rep1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: 0.2% O2 (Balance N2) introduced into flask at a rate of 0.15 cfm and allowed to exit through 0.2 micron filter. Samples (15-60mL) taken via pipette introduced into the flask while gas continued to flow. Samples centrifuged for 5 minutes at 3000 RPM to softly pellet, superenatent decanted and pellet flash frozen in dry ice/ethanol bath.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Grown to mid log phase (OD600 0.3-0.5) in 2L roller bottles with 200-400 mL Middlebrook 7H9 media+ADC and Tween. Diluted to an OD of 0.1 and transferred to three-armed flask.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Pellets were bead beat in the presence of trizol. Aqueus phase isolated using phase lock gel. RNA precipitated in 50% isopropanol 50% high salt solution ((0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). RNA purified using Rneasy columns from Qiagen.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Standard amino-allyl labelling protocol from TIGR. cDNA made with Superscript III using aminoallyl dUTP. cDNA purified using Qiaquick column from Qiagen. Tags conjugated to reactive Cy dyes in the presence of sodium carbonate. Excess Cy dye removed with a Qiaquick column from Qiagen. Probes resuspended in hyb buffer (50% formamide, 5X SSC, and 0.1% SDS) and kept at room temp until added to array slides.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: 0.2% O2 (Balance N2) introduced into flask at a rate of 0.15 cfm and allowed to exit through 0.2 micron filter. Samples (15-60mL) taken via pipette introduced into the flask while gas continued to flow. Samples centrifuged for 5 minutes at 3000 RPM to softly pellet, superenatent decanted and pellet flash frozen in dry ice/ethanol bath.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Grown to mid log phase (OD600 0.3-0.5) in 2L roller bottles with 200-400 mL Middlebrook 7H9 media+ADC and Tween. Diluted to an OD of 0.1 and transferred to three-armed flask.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Pellets were bead beat in the presence of trizol. Aqueus phase isolated using phase lock gel. RNA precipitated in 50% isopropanol 50% high salt solution ((0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). RNA purified using Rneasy columns from Qiagen.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Standard amino-allyl labelling protocol from TIGR. cDNA made with Superscript III using aminoallyl dUTP. cDNA purified using Qiaquick column from Qiagen. Tags conjugated to reactive Cy dyes in the presence of sodium carbonate. Excess Cy dye removed with a Qiaquick column from Qiagen. Probes resuspended in hyb buffer (50% formamide, 5X SSC, and 0.1% SDS) and kept at room temp until added to array slides.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Slides prehybed for >1 hour in prehyb buffer (5X SSC, 0.1% SDS, 1% BSA), washed 2X for 1 minute in water, 15 seconds in isopropanol, dried by centrifugation. Probes added to slides, sealed in incubation chambers and submerged in 42 degree incubator overnight. Arrays washed in increasingly stringent washes: 5 minutes at 42 degrees low stringency wash (0.2%SDS, 1XSSC), 10 minutes lower stringency wash (0.2%SDS, 0.1XSSC), 4 times 1 minute in 0.1XSSC, 10 seconds in 0.01XSSC. Slides dried by centrifugation.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Arrays scanned in with a GenePix4000B using GenePix 6 scanning software. Gain adjusted during preview scan to roughly equivalence between channels with a few saturated spots.
Sample.Data-Processing: Data analysis conducted with Acuity 4 software package. Spots flagged as not found were excised from the dataset. Remaining features were lowess normalized seperately for each print tip.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Mean of all not-flagged features for each substance lowess normalized log2 ratio (hypoxic sample/log phase sample)

Arrays washed in increasingly stringent washes: 5 minutes at 42 degrees low stringency wash (0.2%SDS, 1XSSC), 10 minutes lower stringency wash (0.2%SDS, 0.1XSSC), 4 times 1 minute in 0.1XSSC, 10 seconds in 0.01XSSC. Slides dried by centrifugation.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Arrays scanned in with a GenePix4000B using GenePix 6 scanning software. Gain adjusted during preview scan to roughly equivalence between channels with a few saturated spots.
Sample.Data-Processing: Data analysis conducted with Acuity 4 software package. Spots flagged as not found were excised from the dataset. Remaining features were lowess normalized seperately for each print tip.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Mean of all not-flagged features for each substance lowess normalized log2 ratio (hypoxic sample/log phase sample)

Probes resuspended in hyb buffer (50% formamide, 5X SSC, and 0.1% SDS) and kept at room temp until added to array slides.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Slides prehybed for >1 hour in prehyb buffer (5X SSC, 0.1% SDS, 1% BSA), washed 2X for 1 minute in water, 15 seconds in isopropanol, dried by centrifugation. Probes added to slides, sealed in incubation chambers and submerged in 42 degree incubator overnight. Arrays washed in increasingly stringent washes: 5 minutes at 42 degrees low stringency wash (0.2%SDS, 1XSSC), 10 minutes lower stringency wash (0.2%SDS, 0.1XSSC), 4 times 1 minute in 0.1XSSC, 10 seconds in 0.01XSSC. Slides dried by centrifugation.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Arrays scanned in with a GenePix4000B using GenePix 6 scanning software. Gain adjusted during preview scan to roughly equivalence between channels with a few saturated spots.
Sample.Data-Processing: Data analysis conducted with Acuity 4 software package. Spots flagged as not found were excised from the dataset. Remaining features were lowess normalized seperately for each print tip.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Mean of all not-flagged features for each substance lowess normalized log2 ratio (hypoxic sample/log phase sample)

Series.Title: Defined hypoxic model timecourse of H37Rv and H37Rv:deltadosR
Series.Summary: Background: A significant body of evidence accumulated over the last century suggests a link between hypoxic microenvironments within the infected host and the latent phase of tuberculosis. Studies to test this correlation have identified the M. tuberculosis initial hypoxic response, controlled by the two-component response regulator DosR. The initial hypoxic response is completely blocked in a dosR deletion mutant. Methodology/Principal Findings: We show here that a dosR deletion mutant enters bacteriostasis in response to in vitro hypoxia with only a relatively mild decrease in viability. In the murine infection model, the phenotype of the mutant was indistinguishable from that of the parent strain. These results suggested that additional genes may be essential for entry into and maintenance of bacteriostasis. Detailed microarray analysis of oxygen starved cultures revealed that DosR regulon induction is transient, with induction of nearly half the genes returning to baseline within 24 hours. In addition, a larger, sustained wave of gene expression follows the DosR-mediated initial hypoxic response. This Enduring Hypoxic Response (EHR) consists of 230 genes significantly induced at four and seven days of hypoxia but not at initial time points. These genes include a surprising number of transcriptional regulators that could control the program of bacteriostasis. We found that the EHR is independent of the DosR-mediated initial hypoxic response, as EHR expression is virtually unaltered in the dosR mutant. Conclusions/Significance: Our results suggest a reassessment of the role of DosR and the initial hypoxic response in MTB physiology. Instead of a primary role in survival of hypoxia induced bacteriostasis, DosR may regulate a response that is largely optional in vitro and in mouse infections. Analysis of the EHR should help elucidate the key regulatory factors and enzymatic machinery exploited by M. tuberculosis for long-term bacteriostasis in the face of oxygen deprivation. Keywords: time-course
Series.Overall-Design: Each hypoxic timecourse compared to the matching log phase sample. Each time point/strain represented by a minimum of three replicates.
